image.altText: Carlton public housing towers

props.synopsis: Almost one in five households displaced by a controversial plan to redevelop Melbourne’s public housing towers have been placed in the private market, a parliamentary inquiry has heard.

title.children: Dozens of public housing residents now in private homes ahead of demolition

image.altText: Analyn 'Logee' Osias smiles for a selfie with the sun softly shining on tents behind her.

props.synopsis: Victoria's highest court rejects an appeal by prosecutors to increase the sentence of a man convicted of the "brutal" murder of his former partner in Bendigo.

title.children: Judges quash appeal for harsher sentences for intimate partner violence

image.altText: A man in a baseball cap and black tee smiles at a camera

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old Mildura man convicted of secretly filming an intimate act with a woman using a camera hidden in a wardrobe avoids a prison sentence.

title.children: Victorian man fined for using hidden camera to film secret sex tape

image.altText: Two women hold framed photos of a man and woman.

props.synopsis: The family of siblings killed in a head-on crash in Central Victoria last year says there has been no justice after a 12-month police investigation.

title.children: Family seeks answers after driver in double-fatal crash avoids charges

image.altText: Police attend the scene of a collision between a van and a truck on a road, in which the van was badly damaged.

props.synopsis: The male driver of a van that crashed into the back of a truck in Ravenhall has died.

title.children: One dead after van crushed under parked truck in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Peter Wright wins a ruck against Ned Moyle.

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast Suns' bid for their first finals appearance could come down to the last Wednesday of August, with the AFL locking in a time for the postponed Opening Round fixture.

title.children: Critical game in AFL finals race scheduled for a Wednesday night

image.altText: A house in a large green field.

props.synopsis: Building a house on the wrong block of land does not happen very often, but it happens enough that some states and countries have laws in place to deal with it.

title.children: What the law says about building a house on the wrong block

image.altText: An image of a Toxoplasma Gondii parasite pictured in green, purple and pink.

props.synopsis: International researchers develop a tool to detect toxoplasmosis, a mind-altering parasite that is believed to infect a third of the world's population.

title.children: Online test to detect parasite may lead to learning about behaviour changes

image.altText: A man folds his arms outside a house being built

props.synopsis: Residents in Victoria petition to have input on rooming houses opening near their homes, citing concerns about the potential number of occupants and increased traffic.

title.children: Neighbours want a say in rooming house developments

image.altText: A composite image with two pictures of a left hand with stitches from the index finger down to the wrist.

props.synopsis: A man who almost lost his hand in a machete attack at a Melbourne shopping centre has called into question security measures and is pleading for the government to act.

title.children: 'Not safe anywhere': Machete attacks instil fears in victims and witnesses

image.altText: Inside the historical Mortlock Wing of the State Library of South Australia.

props.synopsis: Adelaide's premier library has been recognised by the 1000 Libraries Awards as second most beautiful in the world, while Victoria has snagged seventh spot.

title.children: Libraries in SA and Victoria among top 10 most beautiful in the world

image.altText: Simon Goodwin and Paul Roos with their arms crossed

props.synopsis: Paul Roos says Melbourne's stars have plenty to play for in the final three games of the season, adding that Simon Goodwin can't have been blindsided by the club's decision to sack him.

title.children: 'Do that at your own peril': Roos warns Demons after coach's sacking

image.altText: A doctor talks to a patient in an office.

props.synopsis: Some GPs are now relying on artificial intelligence to take notes during patient consultations. So, how safe is our sensitive information?

title.children: This GP uses AI with almost every patient he meets

image.altText: A rocky granite island in the ocean.

props.synopsis: When Tasmania broke away from New South Wales politically in the 19th century it was decided all islands south of Wilsons Promontory would belong to the new colony, but it didn't quite work out that way.

title.children: Charting bungle created 'land border' between Tasmania and Victoria

image.altText: Oskar Speck stands infront of hanging chillis, smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Unemployed and seeking a better life, Oscar Speck pushed his kayak into the water of the Danube and began paddling downriver. He didn't stop until he reached Australia.

title.children: After paddling 50,000km, Australian police arrested this German kayaker

image.altText: Grace Baba and Aine McDonagh tackle Gabrielle Seymour

props.synopsis: Hawthorn draftee Grace Baba has her AFLW debut delayed after being suspended for striking in the Hawks' final practice match before the season commences.

title.children: Young Hawk becomes first AFLW player suspended before debut

image.altText: A predominantly white magpie with light brown marbling stands on a patch of green and brown grass with its focus on the ground.

props.synopsis: A bird expert says it appears to have leucism, which affects about one in 30,000 birds and is often confused with albinism.

title.children: Rare white magpie sighted near Melbourne

image.altText: Exterior of the entrance of the Melbourne Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A man who bombarded politicians with "extraordinary" threats and antisemitic messages was desperate for help and support for autism, his lawyers say.

title.children: Autistic man sent politicians antisemitic messages, court hears

image.altText: A blue sign that says Malmsbury Youth Justice Precinct

props.synopsis: Worksafe charges the Victorian Department of Justice over a riot at the troubled Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre, in which a worker and several young people were assaulted.

title.children: Victorian government department faces charges over youth centre riot

image.altText: A faint blue flame is burning from a gas element on a stainless steel cooktop

props.synopsis: The announcement by Solstice Energy will affect more than 1,000 customers, who will be forced to go electric or change to bottled gas.

title.children: Gas supply to 10 regional Victorian towns to be cut by end of 2026

image.altText: Ruby Schleicher of the Magpies warms up before the round four AFLW match.

props.synopsis: Ruby Schleicher fell in and out of Collingwood's side in her early days before settling into the defence where she became an All Australian. Now she's the Magpie skipper and arguably their most important player.

title.children: 'Lucky I wasn’t delisted': Collingwood captain's rollercoaster journey

image.altText: A woman with long grey hair wearing a denim jacket looks at paperwork in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: Melanie and David Moor spent their life savings building a home on a newly subdivided block in Victoria. But they could lose it all after accidentally building on the wrong block.

title.children: Messy legal battle underway after couple builds house on wrong block

image.altText: A drone shot of the area of land where new suburb Beveridge North West is planned the be built.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has green-lit the construction of a large housing precinct in Melbourne's outer north but community members have been left angered after approval for a new quarry was also granted despite their objections.

title.children: Community raises concerns over green-lit plans for new suburb in Melbourne

image.altText: Graphic of a woman looking out onto a hospital. She looks disheveled with messy hair, back turned against the shot.

props.synopsis: Two psychiatrists have told the ABC authorities failed to help protect them from a patient who allegedly violently attacked them and other health professionals.

title.children: Psychiatrists say pleas for protection from violent patient 'ignored'

image.altText: Aunty Joy Murphy holds Indigenous artwork during a Welcome To Country. Greg Inglis and Jesse Bromwich are behind her.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Storm apologises for the late cancellation of a Welcome to Country ceremony which had been scheduled to be held prior to its Anzac Day match.

title.children: Melbourne Storm apologises for cancelled Welcome to Country in Anzac Round

image.altText: CCTV footage of a man in a car park.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a stabbing and affray in northern Victoria which led to two men being taken to hospital.

title.children: Manhunt underway after two men stabbed in Shepparton

image.altText: A police officer and a distressed looking woman sit opposite one another at a dining table in a house.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson is seen handing over a "dummy" phone during a police search of her home, in new vision released by the Supreme Court.

title.children: 'I'll seize that now': Court releases Erin Patterson trial footage

image.altText: Black and white still from CCTV footage of a man wearing a Scream mask and black clothing riding an e-scooter

props.synopsis: CCTV footage shows a masked male spray painting offensive phrases on a Melbourne synagogue.

title.children: Police release CCTV footage of male defacing Melbourne synagogue

image.altText: GettyImages-2187549030

props.synopsis: North Melbourne star Jasmine Garner will have the added responsibility of guiding her side through the club's premiership defence in her first season as captain.

title.children: The unique hangover cure bonding AFLW premiers for life

image.altText: A middle aged woman with glasses stands in front of Sale train station's purple signboard.

props.synopsis: More services will be added to the Gippsland line later this year, but commuters' patience is running short after battling disruptions since 2018, when upgrades began.

title.children: V/Line commuters fed up after two months without trains to east Gippsland

image.altText: Here's Leonardo Puglisi setting up to anchor the 6 News Sunday night bulletin.

props.synopsis: Australian teenagers have grown up on YouTube and admit it can be harmful, but some say the government's blanket ban will do little to address the problems.

title.children: Australian teens reflect on losing YouTube, a gen Z cultural fixture

image.altText: water tower with booktower sign in Wodonga

props.synopsis: A new bookshop in a Wodonga water tower is the latest unique heritage building being transformed in Victoria.

title.children: Victoria's newest bookstore opens in century-old water tower

image.altText: small needles in the skin

props.synopsis: The Health Complaints Commisioner investigates after reports two women were treated for lung damage after receiving a dry needling procedure at a regional Victorian massage clinic.

title.children: Patients treated for lung injuries after dry needling procedure

image.altText: A man sits in front of a bright blue car covered in advertisements.

props.synopsis: In the 80s, racing car Tru Blu was rebuilt thanks to crowdfunding. Now history has repeated to build a cherished replica.

title.children: Town rallies to help man build his dream car after cancer diagnosis
